title: How Iron Man Changed Everything for Marvel
description: Director Jon Favreau was making a movie about a man who could fly, but he wanted to keep the story as earthbound as possible.

title: In A New Open Letter, Experts Call For Policy Action to Avoid Extreme Risks From AI
description: In a new open letter, 24 AI experts call on governments to take action to manage risks from AI.

title: This Company Wants To Replace Fossil Fuel Heating With Batteries
description: Antora Energy is building its first factory to produce thermal batteries. It could be a big move for decarbonizing industrial heat.

title: Tom Emmer Becomes Third House Speaker Nominee Since Kevin McCarthy’s Ouster
description: Emmer remains well short of the 217 votes he needs to before House Speaker.

title: What Aid Groups Say Gaza Needs
description: Only 54 trucks worth of aid have entered Gaza since the start of the Israel-Hamas war.

title: The Gaza Healthcare System Is Reportedly on the Brink of Collapse
description: The U.N. called for more aid Tuesday morning, while Gaza’s health ministry shared that the healthcare system is nearing collapse.

title: As War Rages in Gaza, Violence Surges in the West Bank
description: At least 95 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli soldiers and armed settlers since Oct. 7, making it the bloodiest period in years.

title: AI Needs to Be Regulated Like Nuclear Energy
description: AI labs compare AI risk on par with the existential and safety risks of nuclear, yet they dismiss regulations.

title: ‘Compassion and Humanity Is the Only Way.’ An Israeli Mother on Losing Her Son in the Oct. 7 Attacks
description: Elana Kaminka's son, Yannai, was killed in battle by Hamas militants. He would have turned 21 on Oct. 30.

title: One of the Most Effective Ways to Fund Childcare Does Not Rely on Congress
description: It won't solve the nation's crisis, but it does offer a meaningful partial solution

title: Mayor Says West Maui to Reopen to Tourism on Nov. 1
description: The community has had an impassioned debate about when to welcome travelers back to the disaster-stricken region.

title: Off-Duty Pilot Accused of Trying to Shut Down Engines of a Horizon Air Jet Midflight
description: Authorities in Oregon identified the man as Joseph David Emerson, 44.

title: History Suggests Amazon Will Need the Public on Its Side as It Faces the FTC’s Antitrust Suit
description: In the 1920s, electricity monopolies survived an antitrust investigation because they had won over the public.

title: How We Picked the Best Inventions of 2023
description: Every year for over two decades, TIME editors have highlighted the most impactful new products and ideas in TIME’s Best Inventions issue. To compile this year’s list, we solicited nominations from TIME’s editors and correspondents around the world, and through an online application process, paying special attention to growing fields—such as AI, green energy, and…

title: Why Iceland’s Prime Minister Is Taking a ‘Women’s Day Off’
description: The Nordic island-nation's Prime Minister is joining tens of thousands in a "women's day off" to protest inequality.

title: The Case for Lab-Grown Meat
description: Philip Lymbery explains how space-age cultivated meat might change our taste buds forever.

title: Why Brainstorming Doesn’t Work
description: 'In brainstorming meetings, many good ideas are lost— and few are gained,' writes Adam Grant.

title: Azerbaijan Could Invade Armenia. The U.S. Must Intervene
description: “History has taught us that when terrorists and dictators don’t pay a price, they cause more death and destruction,” President Joe Biden said on Oct. 20, explaining Washington’s backing of Israel and Ukraine. title: As Hamas Fires Thousands of Rockets at Israel, Here’s What to Know About the Iron Dome
description: A look at how the Iron Dome works, how much it costs, and its accomplishments and limitations.

title: China Says Israel Has Right to Self-Defense While Reiterating Call for Deescalation
description: “Every country has the right to self-defense but should abide by international humanitarian law and protect civilians,” Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told his Israeli counterpart Eli Cohen.
